lesson_description: In this lesson, students consider additional strategies to divide fractions including dividing across and using complex fractions as a form of one.‚Äã They then complete statements regarding the size of a quotient, based on whether the dividend or divisor is greater than or less than 1.
learning_goals: I can interpret and compute quotients of fractions to solve real-world problems.
essential_ideas: There are other algorithms to divide fractions, such as dividing across and using complex fractions as a form of 1.

lesson_structure_and_pacing_guide.title: A Pattern of Fractions
lesson_structure_and_pacing_guide.description: Students analyze and identify patterns in two groups of division sentences.

lesson_structure_and_pacing_guide.title: Different Strategies to Divide Numbers
lesson_structure_and_pacing_guide.description: Students consider additional strategies to divide fractions.

materials_needed: If facilitating this lesson without student devices, no additional materials are needed.
To avoid printing additional materials not included in MATHbook (like Activate activities and Session Quick Checks) project them using the Present button above.
